channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2017 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Siding with Roy Moore is another case of the President using his own version of the truth for his political needs
item.description: When reality boxes in President Donald Trump, he simply chooses his own alternative, convenient truth.

item.title: Analysis: Trump just did Roy Moore a huge favor
item.description: President Donald Trump broke his silence Tuesday afternoon on allegations of sexual abuse facing Roy Moore, the Republican Party's Senate nominee in Alabama.

item.title: Inside Trump's decision to embrace Moore
item.description: President Donald Trump's decision to embrace Roy Moore on Tuesday was rooted in several factors, but one of the biggest: the noise and confusion from a recent tidal wave of sexual harassment and misconduct allegations from Hollywood to media to politics.

item.title: Trump defends Moore: 'Look, he denies it'
item.description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday defended embattled Alabama Republican Roy Moore, all but endorsing the Senate candidate who has been accused of sexual assault and child sex abuse.

item.title: A closer look at Roy Moore's wife
item.description: As Roy Moore, the Republican Senate candidate in Alabama, continues to fight against allegations that he sexually assaulted women when they were teenagers, CNN's Martin Savidge reports on Moore's take on the early days of his marriage to his wife Kayla.

item.title: What Roy Moore's accusers say
item.description: As the list of women accusing Roy Moore of sexual assault and harassment grows, listen to what they've said about the Alabama politician so far.

item.title: Report: US soldiers in Asia with Trump had 'improper contact' with women
item.description: Allegations that multiple US service members had "improper contact" with foreign women while on the President's Asia tour have spurred an investigation and led to their reassignment, The Washington Post reports, attributing the information to officials familiar with the situation.

item.title: Trump rips LaVar Ball and calls him an 'ungrateful fool'
item.description: President Donald Trump took to Twitter to continue to rail against LaVar Ball, the father of a UCLA basketball player who was detained for shoplifting in China.

item.title: Trump slams NFL again over anthem protests
Another woman had accused Conyers, court docs show
item.description: Another former staffer alleged that Michigan Democratic Rep. John Conyers sexually harassed her, according to court documents filed in the United States District Court for the District of Columbia in March 2017 and obtained by CNN.

item.title: Interior secretary's wife under scrutiny for travel
item.description: Documents reveal frustration among staffers at the Department of Interior over coordinating travel for Secretary Ryan Zinke's wife on an official trip. CNN's Tom Foreman reports.

item.title: Opinion: How Sarah Sanders humiliated the press
item.description: At Monday's daily press briefing, White House press secretary Sarah Sanders encouraged reporters to first state things they were thankful for before asking their questions. Most of them obliged. They shouldn't have.

item.title: Wife: Rand Paul hasn't taken a single breath without pain since attack
item.description: The average person takes 20,000 breaths a day. Since November 3, my husband, Rand Paul, has not taken a single one without pain. He has not had a single night's sleep uninterrupted by long periods of difficult breathing or excruciating coughing.

item.title: Bosnian Serb wartime army leader gets life for genocide
North Korea calls US terror relisting a 'serious provocation'
item.description: Pyongyang has loudly denounced the decision by the United States to relist North Korea as a state sponsor of terrorism, with a foreign ministry spokesman warning it was a "serious provocation."

item.title: Footage of North Korean defector's escape
item.description: North Korea stands accused of violating the armistice agreement between North and South Korea, after North Korean soldiers fired across the line that divides the two countries in pursuit of a defector last week.

item.title: Lebanon PM puts resignation on hold
item.description: Lebanese Prime Minister Saad Hariri announced Wednesday he was putting his resignation on hold, more than two weeks after he shocked the country by saying he was stepping down.

item.title: 3 missing after US Navy aircraft crashes
item.description: A US Navy aircraft carrying 11 crew and passengers crashed into the Pacific Ocean, southeast of Okinawa on Wednesday.

item.title: Death row lacks lethal injection drugs
item.description: South Carolina lacks the drugs it needs to execute a death row inmate, who was scheduled to die on December 1.

item.title: 36 women from 'SNL' stand up for Franken
Misconduct report: Pixar founder on leave
CBS News and PBS fire Charlie Rose
item.description: CBS News said Tuesday that Charlie Rose's contract has been terminated.

item.title: Former co-anchor: It made my blood boil
item.description: Erica Hill, former co-anchor with Charlie Rose on "CBS This Morning," reacts to the allegations against her former colleague.

item.title: 5 things you need to know today
item.description: Happy Thanksgiving Eve! Five Things is off Thursday, so we hope you have a wonderful holiday. As always, we are thankful for you and everyone in the Five Things family. Now, here's what you need to know to Get Up to Speed and Out the Door. (You can also get "5 Things You Need to Know Today" delivered to your inbox daily. Sign up here.)

item.title: Thanksgiving travel rush
Zimbabwe awaits Mugabe's successor
item.description: Zimbabwe's presumptive leader is due to return to Harare to replace ousted president Robert Mugabe, who resigned under pressure from his own party and the military Tuesday.

item.title: MLB bans ex-Braves GM for life
Gabby Douglas says team doctor abused her, too
Uber hack in 2016 exposed data of 57 million
6 held over Christmas market 'terror plot'
item.description: A possible terror plot on a Christmas market in Germany was uncovered Tuesday after six Syrian nationals were detained in raids by police, a German intelligence official told CNN.

item.title: Internet gobbles up turkey pardon memes
item.description: President Trump pardons "Drumstick" the turkey, sparking jokes about pardons for people. Jeanne Moos talks turkey.

item.title: Photobombing bus spoils view of implosion
item.description: A bus blocks the dome implosion, camera people blow up. CNN's Jeanne Moos has a blast.

item.title: Boy dies after last wish granted
item.description: Jacob Thompson, 9, passed away after a battle with neuroblastoma. He had an early Christmas celebration and received over 40,000 Christmas cards from people all over the world.

item.title: David Cassidy shot to fame as star of 'The Partidge Family'
item.description: David Cassidy, who came to fame as a '70s teen heartthrob and lead singer on "The Partridge Family," has died, according to his publicist Jo-Ann Geffen. He was 67.

item.title: His voice captured the spirit of 1970s youth
item.description: David Cassidy, the wildly popular '70s heartthrob who shot to fame when he starred and sang in TV's "The Partridge Family," has died after a battle with dementia.

item.title: Moments from his life and career
item.description: David Cassidy is known as the wildly popular '70s heartthrob who shot to fame when he starred and sang in TV's "The Partridge Family." Take a look at moments from his career and life.

item.title: David Cassidy said he had dementia
item.description: David Cassidy, the 66-year-old singer and actor, says he is battling dementia.

item.title: People we've lost in 2017
item.description: A look back at notable people who have died in 2017.

item.title: You have to try real hard to have a bad vacation here
item.description: When it comes to Maldives travel, you have to try pretty hard to have a bad vacation.

item.title: Laps of luxury: 17 jaw-dropping pools
item.description: Diving in at the deep end has never been more enjoyable than in these jaw-dropping pools.

item.title: Glass-bottom pool will freak you out
item.description: Market Square Tower's pool suspends 500 feet in the air over downtown Houston.

item.title: Ice tsunamis at the edge of the world
JFK's assassination helped by his bad back
item.description: JFK's life-long struggle with chronic back pain made him one of our sickest presidents and may have kept him from recoiling from Lee Harvey Oswald's first bullet, setting him up for the second, kill shot.

item.title: Macy's Thanksgiving Parade: 6 fun things you may not know
item.description: It's a Thanksgiving Day tradition, not only for New York but for a TV-watching nation as well: the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

item.title: Passengers turn flight delay into party
item.description: When Michelle Sacrey Philpott got to her gate at Pearson International Airport in Ontario for a flight home to Newfoundland, musicians Sean Sullivan and Sheldon Thornhill were playing the guitar and accordion. Fellow passengers joined in, creating a dance party at the gate.

item.title: See French ski resort deemed world's best
item.description: It's not only the highest ski resort in Europe and part of the world's largest ski area -- now Val Thorens has been voted best ski resort in the world for 2017.

item.title: Their technology helps get people face-to-face
Starbucks holiday cups through the years
Top 100 Best Jobs in America
Amanpour: Srebrenica genocide was a defining moment
Rose played role of dirty older man on CBS show
item.description: The sexual harassment and assault claims against powerful men keep rolling in, and this week, it's Charlie Rose under scrutiny after a stunning piece in The Washington Post detailed allegations of years of Rose's harassment and unwanted sexual advances toward younger female employees and prospective employees. In a statement, Rose apologized, adding, "I have behaved insensitively at times, and I accept responsibility for that, though I do not believe that all of these allegations are accurate. I always felt that I was pursuing shared feelings, even though I now realize I was mistaken."

item.title: Pioneering mayor: Diversity is an American value
When the President stopped the presses
I'm having déjà vu on #MeToo
Mortgage rates just plummeted. Lock in now!
Treating primary biliary cirrhosis
3 cards charging 0% interest until 2019
Speier: Conyers not one of harassers I mentioned last week
item.description: Last week, Rep. Jackie Speier said that she knew of two sitting members of Congress who have "engaged in sexual harassment." But the California Democrat on Tuesday said that Democratic Rep. John Conyers of Michigan, who is now facing allegations, was not one of the people she had referenced.

item.title: What John Conyers' colleagues in Congress are saying
item.description: An explosive report rocked Capitol Hill late Monday and early Tuesday, with the allegation that Rep. John Conyers -- the longest-serving active member of the House of Representatives -- settled a wrongful dismissal complaint in 2015 after he was accused of sexually harassing a staffer.

item.title: Accuser's friend: Moore's intentions evident
item.description: Patti Spradlin, friend of Leigh Corfman, a woman who accused Alabama Republican Senate candidate Roy Moore of sexual abuse, recalls her experiences of seeing him at the mall.

item.title: NAFTA talks are in trouble
DNC sees worst October fundraising in 15 years
item.description: The Democratic National Committee's fundraising woes continued last month, when the party posted its lowest total for the month of October in at least 15 years.

item.title: The happiest cities in America
item.description: I've spent my life traveling the world in the pursuit of health and happiness.

item.title: Man who lost nose, mouth describes bear attack
item.description: The grizzly bear grabbed Lee Brooke from behind, pulled him off the ground and then rode on his back down a slope, crushing the left side of his body. It also bit off much of his face. As Brooke lay bleeding, unaware of the extent of his injuries, he could see his nose and mustache on the ground.

item.title: Chrissy Teigen & John Legend are expecting
item.description: Another Legend is set to be born.

item.title: Remembering David Cassidy
item.description: David Cassidy, the wildly popular '70s heartthrob who shot to fame when he starred and sang in TV's "The Partridge Family," has died at the age of 67.

item.title: Pixar's lively 'Coco' hits the right notes
item.description: Pixar gets back to its roots with "Coco," which wraps two universal themes -- pursuing one's dreams, and how we remember loved ones -- in a colorful, culturally specific package. As the animation powerhouse has increasingly turned to the comfort of sequels, this look at the afterlife represents a lively original concept, one that powers through its flat patches with a whole lot of heart.

item.title: Kevin Hart and Eniko Parrish welcome baby
item.description: Kevin Hart has announced the birth of his third child.

item.title: Can Amazon save 'Transparent?'
item.description: "Transparent" could be on the verge of a transformation.
